Research Director  FSR Research Director    Summary:  The Foundation for Sarcoidosis (FSR)  Research Director  will be responsible for leading the execution of FSR’s strategic and operational plans for research development and growth. The Research Director oversees all aspects of FSR’s research department including FSR grant-giving programs, FSR’s patient registry, institution and researcher relations, clinical trial development and recruitment support, and research stakeholder relations with industry, patient-leaders, the NIH, and regulators. The Director is a highly motivated, creative leader dedicated to advancing sarcoidosis research to improve the lives of those living with sarcoidosis.   Reporting Directly to the Chief Strategy Officer, the Research Director is responsible for facilitating, tracking, reporting on, expanding, and optimizing the impact of FSR funding for sarcoidosis research. The   Director will provide strategic input on how to accelerate sarcoidosis research and generate the most significant return on investment for FSR, study sponsors and other funders. The Director will identify, build, and grow FSR’s relations with industry partners, researchers, KOLs, and other entities in a position to advance sarcoidosis research. The Director is responsible for growth, development, and management of FSR’s research team including Research Manager, Research Coordinator, and vendors, consultants and interns.   About the Foundation for Sarcoidosis Research (FSR)    Established in 2000, The Foundation for Sarcoidosis Research (FSR) is the leading international nonprofit organization dedicated to finding a cure for sarcoidosis and improving care for sarcoidosis patients. FSR is based out of Chicago. Since inception, FSR has fostered over $5 million in sarcoidosis-specific research efforts and has worked diligently to provide resources to thousands. For more information and to join our community, visit www.stopsarcoidosis.org.   Remote work is possible.    Job Description:       Advance FSR research program growth, impact, and exposure in collaboration with FSR’s Development and Communications Teams, Chief Executive Office (CEO), and Chief Strategy Officer (CSO).    Manage research agenda and providing strategic input on FSR’s research strategy working closely with FSR’s Scientific Advisory Board (SAB), CEO, CSO, and Governing Board of Directors.    Continuously survey the research landscape to identify new and innovative strategies for accelerating sarcoidosis research.    Manage, increase patient participation, and grow industry and researcher utilization of patients to advance sarcoidosis research.    Manage and grow utilization of FSR’s patient registry.    Build, maintain, and expand relationships with potential funders, clinicians, researchers, industry partners, and other stakeholders key to advancing FSR’s mission.    Manage the FSR research portfolio, budgets, contracting, deliverables tracking, and reporting.    Communicate regularly with clinical investigators, clinical site coordinators, regulatory and safety monitoring staff, laboratory personnel, data coordination center personnel, data analysts, biostatisticians, clinical research coordinators, industry leads and funders, and administrative staff to identify and facilitate progress in sarcoidosis research.    Facilitate and grow FSR Scientific Advisory Board (SAB) and researcher partnerships.    In collaboration CSO, develop RFP/RFQ proposals, fee-for-service proposals, white papers and concept papers.    Serve as FSR representation for research programs to internal and external stakeholders, as needed.    Supervise and mentor research staff to reach ambitious goals.    Other duties as required.     Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities :      Masters Degree, MD, or PhD; preferred in biomedical sciences or public health.    Understanding of immunological diseases, rare disease research and epidemiology, and multi- system chronic illness.    3-5 years’ experience in initiating new strategic growth of research portfolio.    3-5 years’ experience working with industry, regulators, and researchers on research advancement.    3-5 years’ experience in the design and implementation of clinical and/or translational research and epidemiologic studies.    Experience with clinical research methods, including studies utilizing randomized controlled trial, cohort, case-control, and case-series designs.    Experience working with federal and local regulations and policies pertinent to research involving human subjects.    Understanding of statistics and experience with statistical analysis, predictive modelling, simulation, and machine learning, health economics, quality, cost, and outcomes measurement, and rare disease epidemiology.    Working knowledge of SQL and/or SAS.    Understanding of database platforms (RedCap, Assessment Center, and ability to query data from various systems).    Strong project management skills    Knowledge of PCs including MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.    Ability to write clearly and concisely.    Prior management experience, preferred.    Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.    Occasional travel, including international, may be required.     Salary will be determined based on experience and knowledge.    We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for  employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected  veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.   To apply for this position, please provide a resume and cover letter to Tricha Shivas, Chief Strategy  Officer. Please visit www.stopsarcoidosis for more information   Job Type: Full-time   Pay: $75,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year   Benefits:      401(k)    401(k) matching    Dental insurance    Health insurance    Paid time off    Professional development assistance    Tuition reimbursement    Vision insurance     Schedule:      8 hour shift    Monday to Friday     COVID-19 considerations: Following all CDC-advised COVID Precautions.   Education:      Master's (Preferred)     Experience:      Research: 3 years (Preferred)    Project management: 5 years (Preferred)    Leadership: 3 years (Preferred)     Work Location: Multiple Locations

job_title: Senior Credit Risk Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer (Remote)
job_Description: Overview:        Are you looking for a role where you can directly influence an organization in high growth mode? Do you have a knack for solving problems? Do you want to help drive the results of a multi-million-dollar business? If so, you may have found your next role.           We are looking for a self-motivated individual to join our Data Science team as a Senior Credit Risk Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer to be the owner of all Credit Risk business related models. This individual reports to the Director of Data Science and will have significant interactions across the lending organization as well as with our CFO. This individual also manages the information flow for our organization, including the integrity, efficiency, and availability of data. You will participate in day-to-day design, developing, validating, and implementing production scale machine learning and data science models as well as taking ownership of the model lifecycle. Beside the Science behind the models, this individual will be heavily involved in the business aspect of Credit Risk and Lending Operations.                    This role will also require developing credible and trusting relationships with senior leaders, managers, and employees across the organization. Intellectual curiosity, ownership, and detail-orientation are requirements for the role and the department. In addition, this individual will have investor relations activities to maintain strong relationships with external investors and capital markets.    Responsibilities:        Formulate business objectives for growing lending unit of the company and ability to build production scale models within the space of retail credit risk modeling     Build retail credit risk scoring models, produce loan offers that are attractive for the customer, competitive in the market and affordable for the lender.     Identify the data sources, manage quality of the data utilized in models     Develop, implement, numerous experimental and proof of concept approaches for the task     Partner with and interact with Analytics, Technology teams as well as business stakeholders     Being an owner of complete lifecycle of taking a model from the design, implementation and all the way to the production release     Be involved in monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolving data and model issues     Maintain model data documentation, reproducibility, and reports     Qualifications:        ~3-5 years of relevant experience in credit risk analytics, finance, with exposure to FinTech a plus     Understanding and experience in Credit Markets with exposure to retail lending space     Understanding of regulations that affect quantitative consumer credit risk modeling     Experience in building credit risk models with application statistical as well as machine learning     techniques.           Ability to develop professional code beyond notebook implementation, close familiarity with the     code management in Git           Strong technical skills and proficiency in Python programming, machine learning, deep learning,     statistical analysis; Bayesian and causal analysis is a big plus           Ability to manipulate large datasets using SQL in cloud Service environment is a must     Close familiarity and experience with Microsoft Azure products – Azure Synapse analytics and     Azure Machine Learning - is a big plus           Experience in providing solutions on the scale of Big Data in PySpark is a big plus     Strong proficiency in problem solving; ability to formulate a problem statement, identify and QC     needed inputs, and produce and visualize the right outputs is a must           Strong modelling skills and proficiency in relational and non-relational databases; ability to create     new credit risk models, monitor performance of existing models with the ability to provide    improvements and make them competitive to other market players        Preferred Qualifications:               Experience in building production scale credit risk models      Experience in Machine Learning and Data Science modeling techniques      Proficiency in Microsoft Azure cloud environment is a big plus      Familiarity with key languages, such as SQL, Python, PySpark, R      Proficiency in juggling multiple deadlines and managing multiple clients / stakeholders      Proficiency in solving problems while being attentive to details      Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to communicate to C-Level executives      Ability to make the complex simple, and explain model and data through stories                   A Little About Strategic:           Strategic Financial Solutions is an award-winning financial services firm dedicated to helping people live a financially healthy life through the products and services we offer.              We were recently named as one of the Best Companies to Work for in New York State for the 5th time. Additional honors include being named, two times, as one of the 50 fastest growing companies in New York City and to the prestigious Inc. 500 list as one of the 500 fastest growing companies in the United States. Strategic is 100% employee owned, has offices in Manhattan and Buffalo, to house our rapidly growing family of over 900 associates. In June 2021 we proudly celebrated our 14th anniversary.              Strategic is committed to hiring, training, cultivating, promoting, and celebrating an environment where we have a welcoming and fulfilling place for all people to call home. Diversity of race, thought, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, religion, and disability will empower us to thrive as individuals, as teams, and as a company.               LI - Remote

Title: UX Manager   - Ivanti Experience Management  The opportunity:  We are looking for an experienced and talented UX Manager to help us deliver our vision in the Experience Management space (EXM). Ivanti's Experience Management portfolio includes solutions for IT Service Management tools, and our line of business offerings like service management tools for HR, Facilities, Project Management, Finance, Legal and Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC). By leveraging AI and Machine Learning our Experience Management solutions transform the experience of our customers' employees across all areas of the enterprise.  You will help to define and shape the user experience of our EXM products, in close collaboration with product and technical leaders, along with your fellow UX Manager teammates in our global UX organization.  Ivanti is investing heavily in UX and has taken big strides towards implementing research and validation practices at scale across our product development teams. We are laser-focused on delivering better products, and the success of our customers.  Ivanti UX is made up of product cross-pillar teams of UX Designers and Front-End Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. You are a thoughtful team leader, manager, systems-level design thinker, and visionary - with strong instincts and outstanding intuition informed by user needs and insights. You'll be responsible for guiding the careers of your team members, working closely with each of them to help them realize their full potential.  UX Design Managers are fierce advocates for the people who use our products as well as the members of their teams. They have a practiced eye for effective design and are committed to creating elegantly simple user experiences from otherwise complex workflows.  Experience Required:   6+ years of experience in UX Design with user-centered design techniques and methodologies in B2C or B2B organizations as in-house design  4+ years experience managing or leading design teams with people management  Portfolio of UX-focused work examples for web and mobile applications   Preferred qualifications:   Bachelor's Degree or master's degree in User Experience, Interaction Design, Human Factors, Psychology, or a related field  Experience with managing Jira and Confluence project sites  Experience using quantitative reporting tools like Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics  Excellent communication and presentation skills with multiple audience types  Experience designing for Enterprise SaaS applications  Experience working in large UX teams   What we look for in a candidate   You're an enthusiastic leader that commands respect and inspires people  You've demonstrated success in creating a collaborative culture of Design, Development and Product  You have a passion for user experience design with deep knowledge of leading methodologies and practices  You possess an outstanding ability to communicate design ideas to Product and Development teams  You have a proven track record of success in improving processes and communication throughout the product development lifecycle and across all levels  You have extensive experience in leading design research and communicating the impacts to the design strategy across the organization  You possess a proven ability to succeed in Lean and Agile environments  You have experience operating in a matrix organizational structure  You have experience designing for various form factors and environments including web, desktop and mobile (Native & Responsive)  You have a deep understanding of measurable success in coaching design teams to innovate across platforms   Responsibilities:   Provide leadership, direction, and mentorship for a team of UX Designers; lead creative and holistic thinking across diverse product releases, platforms, and devices  Deliver a UX vision, along with a plan for evolutionary, iterative updates, that actualize the larger vision over time  Build strong relationships and operating rhythms with leaders inside and outside their core product team to efficiently implement user experiences that are cohesive, inclusive, and well-informed  Foster a healthy design culture and principles within the group, while setting new standards in executional and operational excellence  Be responsible for and effectively advocate for users in a fast-paced, corporate climate, imparting day-to-day design leadership that fosters a shared understanding of the user-centric intersection between design, content, business, and engineering  Work closely with product partners to determine UX scope, level of effort, timing and UX deliverables  Lead design workshops to foster collaboration and prioritization   #LI-JM1  #LI-REMOTE

The opportunity:  We are looking for a talented UX Designer or Sr. UX Designer to help our vision in the Ivanti Neurons space. Ivanti's Neurons portfolio includes solutions for Neurons Discovery, Neurons for Healing, Edge Intelligence, Neurons Workspace, Neurons Platform and the Employee Experience product. By leveraging AI and Machine Learning, our Neurons solutions transform the experience of our customers' employees across all areas of the enterprise.  You will help to define and shape the user experience of our Neurons Platform products in close collaboration with product and technical leaders and teams, along with your UX peers in our global UX organization. You will also have the opportunity to bring in new innovations and experiences to our large customer base covering a wide range of different industries and verticals.  Ivanti is investing heavily in UX and has taken big strides towards implementing research and validation practices at scale across our product development teams. We are laser-focused on delivering better products, and the success of our customers.  What you'll do:   Lead and engage in research and discovery activities to develop deep empathy with our customers and understand their needs and challenges. Produce and communicate user personas, user journeys, user flows.  Conduct and facilitate research workshops and sessions in collaboration with user researchers, product leaders, and UX peers.  Design, conduct and communicate research initiatives.  Assist in defining the problems to be addressed and the outcomes we want to create with our products.  Ideate design solutions at all levels of fidelity, from rough whiteboard and paper sketches through to polished visual designs or prototypes when necessary.  Document your designs with well-thought-out use cases, functional specifications for interactions or animations, responsive behaviors, and accessibility standards.  Manage your projects with standard project processes that encourage and grow communication, collaboration and partnerships using collaboration tools like Jira, Confluence, and Teams.  Work closely with product partners to determine UX scope, level of effort, timing and UX deliverables.  Lead the UX testing and validation of your design solutions, iterating and enhancing them in line with the results and feedback obtained.  Work closely with the design systems team to standardize and innovate on components, design patterns, and implementation of the design system.  Mentor and lead other more junior designers on the team.   Experience Required:   At least 3-5 years of experience in UX Design with UCD techniques and methodologies in B2C or B2B organizations as in-house design  Portfolio of UX-focused work examples for web and mobile applications   Preferred qualifications:   Bachelor's Degree or master's degree in User Experience, Interaction Design, Human Factors, Psychology, or a related field  Experience with using Jira and Confluence project sites in agile teams  Experience using quantitative reporting tools like Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics  Excellent communication and presentation skills with multiple audience types  Experience designing for Enterprise SaaS applications  Experience working in large UX teams What we look for in a candidate:   You are an experienced designer with experience working with Responsive cloud or SaaS products.  You are comfortable playing a leading role in the product design process, guiding a cross-functional team through workshops, design sprints and discovery activities.  You will be able to showcase a strong UX portfolio containing projects that demonstrate the end-to-end process from initial research, through ideation, prototyping and testing, all the way to delivery of the final product.  You will be curious and tenacious in wanting to understand the underlying causes of problems and user behaviors, employing both qualitative and quantitative research techniques to achieve this.  You communicate clearly, confidently, and persuasively, using sound rationale to reinforce your views and decisions, and influence people at all levels.  You instinctively build positive relationships, partnering and collaborating effectively across the wider organization, and multiple geographies.  You demonstrate business acumen and the ability to think strategically.  You lead by example and inspire those around you to do their best work.   Senior candidates:   Contribute strategic design vision and big picture thinking.  Set the bar for other designers in the group.  Advise, support and mentor less experienced members of the team.  Work horizontally across the product teams to drive alignment and consistency, playing a key role in bringing everything together.   Why choose Ivanti?   Join a large, rapidly evolving global UX team of over 20 designers, with plans to grow by 50% within the next 6 months.  Work for a company that is truly invested in UX, where research and discovery work is not only expected, but highly valued.  Leverage and contribute to the development of a world class design system.  Receive support from an established DesignOps team with dedicated front-end resources and soon a dedicated research function.  Embark on a defined career path with real opportunities to grow and advance.  Enjoy a highly competitive salary along with an outstanding benefits package.   #LI-JM1  #LI-REMOTE

Cognitive Neuroscientist (Data Scientist)   About Intheon   We have an exciting opportunity available for the right person to join us at Intheon, a San Diego based startup powering the practical application of neurotechnology in everyday life. We are pioneering a comprehensive platform for neural and biosignal processing and multi-modal analytics. Our platform, products, and automated workflows are used by leading companies and research institutions around the world to accelerate scientific R&D in areas such cognitive state decoding, neural biomarker discovery, exploratory analysis, hypothesis testing, scientific validation, and statistical and machine-learning analyses, real-time cognitive measures, etc. Our real-time data processing and BCI technology stack empowers developers to create transformative brain- and body-aware applications impacting health and wellness, human performance, learning, experiential technology, and more.   To learn more about Intheon’s vision, visit our website at www.intheon.io, as well as these resources :      Spotlight talk at BrainMind Summit @ MIT:     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ArgM7henCjo      Talk at Transformative Technologies Conference 2020:     https://vimeo.com/480503329   Responsibilities      You will develop processes and pipelines for state-of-the-art brain- and biosignal processing and analysis (EEG, NIRS, ExG, eye tracking and others) for a variety of study and statistical designs, both for post-hoc analysis and real-time uses.    Most of your work will be on workflows used in production by clients, in Intheon’s products (NeuroPype, NeuroScale), and in in-house R&D, and will leverage the Python ecosystem, with occasional limited use of MATLAB or R tools.    Working with an interdisciplinary team, you will continuously expand your skill set and bridge between neuroscience, statistics, signal processing, machine learning and other disciplines, follow current research and findings in the neurosciences, and help distill these findings into a new generation of automated, robust, and large-scale processing suites for brain- and biosignal data.    You will also advise on and contribute to experimental designs for neuroscience research and validation studies (in-house or in collaboration with clients and partners).    You will contribute to the extension of Intheon’s software stack and product platform through the development, implementation, and validation / testing of published and pre-publication methods.     Professional Requirements      Doctorate (Ph.D.) degree or Master’s (M.S.) degree with equivalent years of experience in one of Cognitive Science, Computational Neuroscience, Electrical Engineering / Computer Science, Statistics, Theoretical Physics, or a related field.    Excellent communication skills, ability to self-manage projects, and motivated team player.    A desire to thrive and grow in a fast-paced and challenging high-tech startup environment working on advanced research projects.    Professional conduct respecting HIPAA and other applicable regulations, as well as confidentiality requirements of Intheon’s customers and partners.    Commitment to maintaining an open, welcoming, harassment-free, and equal-opportunity workplace.     Technical Requirements   Required skills:      Demonstrated solid knowledge of neuroscientific principles, conceptual models, and current literature. Track record of peer-reviewed scientific publications.    Familiarity with current-generation neural data analysis techniques, particularly related to electrophysiology (e.g., spectral analysis, source estimation / localization, functional / effective connectivity, multi-subject analysis, artifact removal). Experience with other neural and non-neural modalities is a plus.    Solid programming skills (clean, well-documented and well-tested code).    Prior experience working with Python data science tools (e.g., numpy, scipy, pandas, matplotlib, jupyter, statsmodels, etc.).    Demonstrated solid understanding of, and prior experience working with, various general-purpose signal processing techniques (e.g., spectral analysis methods, filter designs, linear component analysis methods).    Firm understanding of the inner workings, assumptions, and applicable range of various statistical models, including commonly-used frequentist and Bayesian models, and demonstrated experience applying such models. Comfortable applying statistical validation techniques and criteria.    Solid grounding in common human-subject experiment paradigms and experiment design principles for eliciting neural or behavioral responses.    Excellent problem-solving skills, knack for abstract mathematical thinking (e.g., vector/matrix/tensor data, high-dimensional spaces, probability distributions, etc.).    Excellent English verbal and written communication skills.    High-quality clear writing for contributions to scientific manuscripts, technical reports, technical documentation, and user guides.    Able and willing to fill any knowledge gaps quickly and to learn the necessary theory and tools.     Expertise in one or more of the following areas is a plus:      Applying hierarchical Bayesian models, related estimation/inference techniques (samplers, variational Bayes, etc.) and popular tools (e.g., Stan, PyMC3, etc.).    Adaptive/online statistical signal processing and the underlying principles (e.g., RLS, Kalman filters, etc.).    Sparse signal processing / modeling (e.g., compressive sensing, structured sparsity).    High-performance computing tools and techniques in Python (e.g., jax, cupy, dask). Julia familiarity a plus.    Machine learning and/or deep learning (overfitting, cross-validation, regularization / priors, optimization, etc.).     Job Type: Full-time, can be remote if located in the U.S. or Canada.   Intheon is fully committed to the principle of equal opportunity employment for all. We welcome all applicants, and each applicant is considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, disability status, or any other status protected by applicable laws and regulations.   Note:  Intheon   will not sponsor applicants for work visas (e.g. H-1B) for this position. You will find here a highly productive, collaborative, and innovative environment where your voice is heard.   This position is 100% remote!     THE ROLE:         Participate in the architecture and development of new micro-services for multiple enterprise-level products. You will be building core common services.      Use technology to solve business problems and drive positive outcomes      Build a scalable technology platform to support a growing business      Ask questions and never stop learning      Deliver high-quality code to production      Collaborate with DevOps for cloud deployment      Work closely in an agile team of product owners, data scientists, business analysts and engineers in a collaborative environment      Develop brand new RESTful or Event-Driven services        REQUIREMENTS/CHARACTERISTICS:         Minimum of 6+ years experience as a Software Engineer      Experience coding in Java, Python, C++, Node.js (any OOP)      All the micro services are written in Go. However, it is not a requirement to have experience in Go. We are looking for candidates that would enjoy the challenge of learning and using Go.      You have designed, built, and maintained REST APIs for use in production and you have experience working with Open API standards like Swagger.      You can solve problems quickly and independently      Experience using Events Framework or Architecture (Kafka, Pub/Sub, Kinesis)      Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process preferred      Familiarity with DevOps, continuous delivery, configuration management, and tools is desired      Knowledge of Microservices and respective architecture design principles and scalability best practices.      Experience working with data: SQL, NoSQL, key-value store, etc.      Experience with Google Cloud Platform is highly preferred but not required.      Experience with Docker and/or Kubernetes highly preferred but not required        CULTURAL FIT (Our Core Values):         Care (for everyone):  We show compassion and contribute to the well-being and growth of those around us. We only pursue products that improve the financial lives of our clients.      Act with Integrity (every time):  We take the right action even when it is hard and even when no one is watching. We treat our employees, clients, and communities the way they wish to be treated.      Get Better (every day):  We innovate, iterate, and improve each day. We are creative, take thoughtful risks, and ultimately learn and recover from failures.      Collaborate (with everybody):  We strive to work together toward a common purpose by proactively sharing information and inviting participation. We recognize the perspective of various groups and embrace a healthy, constructive debate.        WHY JOIN THE FREEDOM FAMILY?         Fast, continued growth – there’s a lot of opportunity for advancement      Voted the Best Place to Work multiple times by our employees, most recently #1 in Phoenix for the 2nd year in a row!      Benefits start within 30 days      401(k) with employer match      3 weeks paid vacation (increased with tenure)      9 paid holidays & 5 sick days      Paid time off for volunteer work and on your birthday        About Us:     Freedom Financial Network is a leading digital personal finance company, built to help people. We do what traditional banks don’t: Put people first. We believe in treating people like humans, not account numbers. We help everyday people get on, and stay on, the path to a brighter financial future, with innovative technology and personalized support at every step. We help people control expenses, manage debt, save money, plan ahead, and make better financial decisions. By leveraging our proprietary data and analytics and artificial intelligence we offer solutions tailored for each step of a consumer's financial journey, including personal loans, home equity loans, help with debt, and even financial tools and education.     With 2,400 employees across California, Arizona and Texas, we have served more than 1 million customers, resolved more than $15 billion in consumer debt and originated $6.5 billion in loans over the course of our 20 years in business.     Driven by our core values, we’re passionate about supporting our communities and proudly awarded over $500,000 in grants distributed by the Freedom Foundation Fund and the Freedom Family Fund in 2021. We believe in a culture led by diversity, equity, and inclusion, and encourage our employees to bring their full selves to work every day. Our diversity-focused Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) are open to all, whether a member of the ERG community or an ally of the group and we are a member of the Fintech Racial Equity Coalition to address and improve inequality in the fintech industry.     And finally, we take great pride in our achievements. This year we topped the list of Best Place to Work by the Phoenix Business Journal, were a top 100 Corporate Philanthropist by the San Francisco Business Times, a 2021 Most Admired Company and a Tech Company with the Best Company Culture by BestCompaniesAz, a 2021 Top Work Places winner by AZCentral and a BuiltIn Best Places to Work winner, to name a few.     #LI-BS1     #dice     #LI-Remote

What You Will Do: Knowledge of end-to-end systems development life cycles. Write unit, functional, acceptance, and/or user tests. Lifespark’s Product and Engineering team is growing! We are having great success building custom solutions for our teammates to bring to light the first-ever community-based population health platform. Our focus, and our passion is to provide holistic Lifecare, not just healthcare, to help people age magnificently. Come join us and be a part of building something truly meaningful from the ground up with a diverse team of committed, humble, awesome people — all fully remote from anywhere in the country!  Lifespark, headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota (with our engineering team spread across the country), has been sparking lives for 15 years and it is time to take our “Whole Person Senior Care” model to a greater reach. To do that, we need you to come and help us build the “best in class” platform for whole-person health. Lifespark has an award-winning culture - LeadingAge 'Excellence in the Workplace' 2015 award winner, and Star Tribune Top 100 Workplace 2014. We are focused on breaking the roller coaster of the health care crisis by stopping re-hospitalizations. With our Lifespark ExperienceTM, we are improving the journey for people in the second half of life, using proactive guidance and just the right level of support to create a pathway to living a more meaningful and gratifying life. In short, we spark lives. To find out more, visit  www.lifespark.com . As our Lead Data Analyst, you will provide leadership across our data analytics efforts. With your expertise, we will use data insights to support Lifespark Complete, our unique approach to holistic senior health. In this new role, you will be laying the foundations of how we unlock the insights hidden within all our data. In partnership with Director of Data and Analytics, you will help define our strategies around data governance, security, and analytics. You will bring your passion for how data can transform lives. This hands-on role will require the development of solid processes around data cleanliness, data wrangling, descriptive analysis, as well as actively engage in Lifespark’s machine learning initiatives. Have your favorite toolset? We would love to hear about how you have done this in the past. This role requires excellent communication skills, you will be a fantastic storyteller as you identify new business questions, develop analytical methods to answer those questions, and conduct experiments to validate our assumptions. All while being hyper-focused on quality outcomes for our members. Come use your superpowers for good and join us in Sparking Lives. How will you spend your  days : Building solutions for our model - Identification systems, clinical decision support, predictive, survival analysis, etc. Delivering and supporting the delivery of retroactive analysis to provide a deeper understanding of the Lifespark Complete initiatives. Develop dashboards, maintain their accuracy over time. Working closely with data engineers and scientists to develop features, predictive and prescriptive models that have a solid impact on senior’s lives. Actively collaborate with business partners throughout the population health organization to closely align data products with actionable insights that drive interventions and lead to improved outcomes. Contribute to building and testing machine learning models that increase population health efficacy. Presenting compelling reports that support the business with powerful stories and statistically sound analysis. What you’ll bring to the team: BS in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or equivalent. 5+ years of data analytics experience. Ability to analyze large amounts of structured and unstructured data. Broad understanding and demonstrated history of applying various methods to bring tremendous value to people. Superior expertise with Python and SQL to analyze Healthcare data is a must for succeeding in this role. Hands-on expertise with data mining and dashboarding (using Looker or a similar tools) is required. Proven track record with reporting, presentations, and other storytelling methodologies. Deeper understanding or experience with techniques such as clustering, classification, regression, tree-based methods, neural nets, support vector machines, anomaly detection is a strong plus. A commitment to testing and quality. Come teach us a thing or two about your approach toward quality. A bias toward action. You love to push things forward and find creative ways to work around blockers. A positive and energetic attitude Deep experience as a remote contributor. We are fully distributed throughout the US; come help us make it better. Willingness and ability for travel and off-hours support - we need to get together occasionally, and see each other's smiling faces, let’s meet in your hometown! IT HAS BEEN AND WILL CONTINUE TO BE OUR POLICY TO PROVIDE EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES TO ALL EMPLOYEES AND APPLICANTS WITHOUT REGARD TO RACE, COLOR, CREED, RELIGION, SEX, GENDER IDENTITY, PREGNANCY, NATIONAL ORIGIN, CITIZENSHIP, MARITAL STATUS, FAMILIAL STATUS, AGE, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, VETERAN STATUS, DISABILITY, PUBLIC ASSISTANCE STATUS, GENETIC INFORMATION OR ANY OTHER STATUS PROTECTED BY FEDERAL, STATE, OR LOCAL LAW. #LSCORP

Fueled by creativity and ideation, World Wide Technology strives to accelerate our growth and nurture future innovation. From our world-class culture to our generous benefits, to developing cutting-edge technology solutions, WWT constantly works towards its mission of creating a profitable growth company that is a great place to work. We are looking for a Senior Endpoint Security Consultant to join our team within Consulting Services. Why should you join the  Global Security Practice  Consulting  T eam ? As a member of the Global Security Practice Consulting Services team, you will have the opportunity to work with experts in the cybersecurity field. You will engage with Sales Leadership, Global Client Executives, Account Managers, Consulting Solution Engineers (CSEs), Consulting Solution Architects (CSAs) to help facilitate client understanding of the WWT Cyber Security Service and Solutions Capabilities. This position provides exposure to new, cutting-edge security product and technologies from some of the most respected companies in this space. That along with the ability to innovate in WWT's Advanced Technology Center (ATC) presents an environment to continually hone your skills. What will you be doing?  WWT is currently seeking a Consultant specializing in Endpoint Security to support a wide range of clients in the commercial and federal space. This position is primarily a delivery role for Endpoint Security services engagements with Fortune 500 companies. The Senior Consultant will be providing a multitude of Endpoint Security services to assist clients with improving their overall security posture and maturity. This will be accomplished by applying industry best practices and guidance from regulations, standards and frameworks like the National Institute of Standards and Technology Cybersecurity Framework (NIST CSF, 800-53, etc.), International Standards Organization (ISO 27001 & 2, etc.), Center for Internet Security (CIS), Payment Card Industry (PCI), Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPPA), and Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council (FFIEC). This position is for a senior-level security consultant performing a range of services that includes the creation and maturation of an enterprise's Endpoint Security strategy in support of the overarching cybersecurity program. Programs will be based on an analysis of a multitude of drivers (i.e., business, regulatory, risk, technical, potential solutions); analyzing current state, and determining a solution that addresses a chosen customer deficiency. Additional factors will be leading practices and best-of-breed solution recommendations based on the total cost of ownership, return on investment, and compatibility with existing architecture and programs. The candidate must be able to direct an engagement, including the development of an Endpoint Security plan, design, and implementation, along with the creation of professional-level deliverables. As required, the Senior Endpoint Security Consultant will lead initiatives, with other key supporting participants in areas such as security, engineering, networking, etc. needed to deliver an engagement from start to end successfully. This is not a managing role, but the candidate must be willing to take ownership of engagements and mentor growing Endpoint Security Consultants and Associate Endpoint Security Consultants. Working in a team environment, the Senior Endpoint Security Consultant will be representing WWT as the subject matter expert on all areas for Endpoint Security. The Senior Consultant will possess specific skill sets related to Endpoint Security processes, be technically diversified with security products and solutions related to Endpoint Security and possess the expertise to participate in a project comprised of technical and non-technical members. The Senior Consultant will have extensive and demonstrated knowledge of risk management methodologies and approaches to measuring effectiveness, understand and eloquently explain endpoint security concepts, and have practical experience dealing with highly diverse technical environments. The required skill set will include a demonstrable ability in the development of professional-level deliverables and highly effective skills in the presentation and communication of the deliverables in terms of findings, recommendations, controls, and business-level concepts to reduce risk for WWT Clients. Responsibilities:   Lead Endpoint Security teams and internal WWT teams in cybersecurity delivery engagements for a wide variety of clients in different industry verticals Consult with customers and client executives in a pre-sales and post-sales capacity to define Endpoint Security strategy Possess the ability to work in and take leadership in a client environment and engagement Possess the ability to develop a multitude of relationships with excellent communication skills to include with internal WWT teams, WWT Sales teams, and customer teams Through the application of industry standards and security best practices, develop and recommend plans to structure secure architectures, infrastructure, and tools Define and promote Endpoint Security programs, architectures, and technologies that can meet compliance and regulation requirements, while improving the security posture of an organization Apply expert-level knowledge to Endpoint Security challenges for development of unique solutions Understand the security interplay in the areas of application assurance, data classification, network security, and emerging IT trends and threats Analyze and assess client-facing security challenges, identify recommendations for solutions, and define a roadmap to implement such solutions successfully Develop and deliver workshops in the areas of Endpoint Security Develop reports and supporting presentations for both client and internal discussions with excellent communication skills Produce clear outcomes and results using industry best practices

At Intramotev, we are building self propelled autonomous railcars and vehicles to change the paradigm in rail logistics. We're providing the rail industry tools that will make the 200 year old industry competitive for the next 200 years. By helping us make rail competitive with trucking, you can contribute to work that matters in solving big societal problems like reducing emissions, improving safety, and minimizing road congestion. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.     Intramotev is seeking a Senior Autonomy Software Lead to join the software development team to meet growing demands in the development of autonomous rail vehicles. Intramotev is developing multiple unmanned autonomous vehicles. The role has a strong software focus – the successful candidate will lead development of innovative autonomous capabilities in areas such as Detect and Avoid, Contingency Management, Multi-Vehicle Collaboration, etc., for current and future platforms. The development of these capabilities include multidisciplinary skills including: algorithm development (including AI/ML), system development and integration, and knowledge of cloud computing/simulation at scale. This position will be based out of St. Louis, MO     This position will involve executing applied research projects in automated decision making, machine perception, multi-vehicle collaborative control and autonomy architectures that will enable innovative capabilities (e.g. Detect and Avoid, Contingency Management, Multi-vehicle collaborative mission management) for current and future products. Work will include leading technology development efforts to prove the feasibility of new capabilities and can include integration and maturation up through full scale testbeds. Software efforts will also include work with simulations, control stations, networking/communications systems and cloud computing to support the testing of the new capabilities.     This position involves working in a dynamic team environment on small (1-2) to medium (3-6) person projects where excellent interpersonal and communication skills are needed. Due to the research nature of the work, project objectives and requirements are likely to evolve over the course of the role. A small amount of domestic travel to support integration, demonstration and customer engagement will be required.     Build your career with us, as together we develop the next generation of rail, rapidly connecting the past and the future to make a faster and more environmentally friendly rail connected world.     Position Responsibilities         Provides technical leadership for software projects and leads software development activities.      Develop, and deliver autonomy capability solutions, working closely with internal and external stakeholders.      Develop algorithms for sensing, perception and decision-making (including AI/ML algorithms)      Develop systems architectures, processes, tools to address unique verification and validation challenges, including certification      Leads development of code and integration of complex software components into a fully functional software system.      Leading software development in cloud computing environments (i.e. GCP, Azure, AWS)      Leading the integration, test and transition of capabilities with simulation, hardware-in-the loop, and test-beds; and onto the platforms themselves.      Integrate application software, operating systems, middleware, and sensing/computer hardware, to develop/deliver complete solutions      Use software best practices – requirements analyses, architecture, design, code, and test to develop solutions      Use simulation-at-scale, and other methodologies to test different autonomy approaches      Work with and guide a team of talented engineers      Win and execute new business      Prior experience with UAV and/or robotics testing is desired but not required      Coordinates activities across a global team of researchers        Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience)         At least a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Science      4+ years coding in 3rd generation languages include C, C++, C# and/or Python programming      Excited to keep learning, willing to expand into technical areas beyond your current expertise; ability to develop, innovative, and apply novel approaches      Productive working in a teaming environment and also as an individual contributor      Fluent in both written and verbal English        Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience)     Candidate should have a working knowledge of one or (ideally) multiple areas listed below:         Unmanned Rail Systems / Unmanned Systems      Demonstrated experience working across organizational boundaries.        Typical Education and Experience:     Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 9 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD+4 years' related work experience, Master+7 years' related work experience, 9 years' related work experience, etc.).     Relocation:     This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.     Vaccination Requirements:     Intramotev does not currently require vaccination for COVID 19.     Equal Opportunity Employer:     Intramotev is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.        Schedule     Full time

Description:     About the Job:     Herjavec & Fishtech Group  is looking for a dedicated, creative, and experienced Software Engineer II (Data) to join the Engineering team. The candidate should have experience working efficiently on small teams, being flexible filling roles, and be familiar with cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP). The primary function will be contributing directly to CYDERES data ingestion and alerting pipelines. We are looking for someone who embraces distributed programming concepts, has experience using git on a team, and has a practical understanding of machine learning concepts. Candidate should be detail-oriented, able to handle multiple high-priority demands while driving consistent results and have a passion for delivering well-engineered and tested code. Candidate should also bring the right attitude to the team including accountability, ownership, and positivity. We embrace the fast-paced development field and are looking for like-minded individuals that have a passion for continual improvement, new languages/ideas, tinkering with new projects, and taking on complex problems.     Responsibilities:         Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software      Help with technical implementations and discussions of roadmap items      Mentor entry-level engineers, assist junior-level engineers and inspect and test their code      Work with team lead on system architecture and continuous improvements      Help with initiatives for improving system reliability      Document/demonstrate solutions by developing documentation, diagrams, code comments and clear code      Working with other teams inside the organization and product management to collect feedback, align requirements, and translate business requirements      Occasionally take part in architecture and roadmap meetings with leadership      Contribute in team meetings and architecture discussions      Participate in on-call rotation for outages pertaining to CYDERES ingestion pipelines        About the Company:     Herjavec & Fishtech Group  is the #1 cloud native security-as-a-service solutions provider enabling secure and successful business transformation. Based in Kansas City,  Herjavec & Fishtech Group  includes the 24/7/365 cyber defense and response division CYDERES.     CYDERES  is human-led, machine-driven Security-as-a-Service powered by our proprietary cloud native platform and Google Cloud Chronicle. CYDERES supplies the people, process, and technology to help organizations manage risk, detect threats, and respond to incidents in real time. Named Google Cloud Chronicle's Partner of the Year two years in a row, CYDERES is a Top 25 MSSP, advancing in 2021 to #21, eclipsing older and larger competitors.     CYDERES  delivers real change in the information security industry and help customers solve for the fragmented security solution landscape and the industry-wide skills shortage.     CYDERES  values a customer-first, raise-your-hand, and constant improvement approach every day.  . Requirements:     Minimum Qualifications:         Experience in cloud based environments (AWS, Azure, GCP)      Knowledge of GCP PubSub/Kafka/message queue systems      Experience with containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes/Docker)      Knowledge of configuration management technologies (Terraform/Vagrant/Puppet/Chef/Ansible)      Familiarity with Elasticstack solutions (Logstash, Fluentd, Fluentbit, Elasticsearch, etc)      Ability to quickly and effectively learn Golang      Experience with agile (SCRUM) methodology      Knowledge of professional software engineering/best practices for software dev life cycle, including code standards, reviews, build processes, testing, and operations      Git and CI/CD tools (Spinnaker, Jenkins, GitHub, etc) experience      Networking skills        Preferred Qualifications:         Bachelor’s degree      At least 2 years working in the development field      At least 1 year working with cloud technologies (AWS/GCP)        Other Duties:     Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for their job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.     Work Environment:     If candidate is local to Kansas City, then this position is encouraged to primarily work on-site at our HQ to encourage collaboration. Some roles allow for remote candidates.

From Fivetran's founding until now, our mission has remained the same: to make access to data as simple and reliable as electricity. With Fivetran, customer data arrives in their warehouses, canonical and ready to query, with no engineering or maintenance required. We're proud that more organizations continue to leverage our technology every day to become truly data-driven. The Solution Architect Team at Fivetran  It's an exciting time here at Fivetran. We have grown our revenue, customer base and team very substantially over the past several years. We continue to grow fast and are rapidly growing our Customer Success teams; Customer Support, Account Management, Sales Engineering and starting up a brand new department - Solution Architect Team  At Fivetran, we want to enable our customers to make data backed decisions company wide by delivering ready to query data quickly and reliably into their cloud data warehouses. We work with companies from around the world to help them better understand their customers and products, and develop a truly data-driven culture.  To support our growth, we're in the process of building out our Customer Success function with a mission to retain, activate, upsell and delight our customers. This is one of the most exciting, strategic and quickly evolving teams at Fivetran.  We're looking for a Senior Solution Architect recruit to join our Customer Success team and own a portfolio of high-profile customer relationships from day one. This role could be a great fit if you have experience in Technical Account Management, Solutions Engineering or Technical Customer Success for a software product and experience in the modern data stack. We are still interested to hear from you if you have a different background that you think would make you a great fit.  The ideal candidate lives in the Pacific or Mountain time zone. The Opportunity  At Fivetran we see Customer Success as a key growth function of the business, with Solution Architects helping drive a technical perspective helping us be more holistic with our customers. We don't see Customer Success merely as a retention function but as a key to exceeding our ambitious Net Revenue Retention targets, driving adoption across our customers' organizations.  On a day to day basis, you will completely own a portfolio of strategic accounts and provide ad hoc assistance to smaller accounts. These accounts will be across multiple verticals and located across North, Central and South America. You will own the customer relationship from a technical perspective, from onboarding through to continued adoption and usage. From initial activation, you will help our customers translate complex business needs into data driven solution designs on top of, working alongside our Sales Engineers and Account Managers as new opportunities arise.. You will work collaboratively with stakeholders at your accounts to map and realize the value they want to derive from our platform, driving wider institutional adoption of Fivetran as you go. You will serve as the internal voice of your customers and become a go to technical resource internally and externally.  In addition to working directly with and on behalf of customers, Senior Solution Architects will be looked to for raising the technical knowledge level of many different internal roles. As a highly proficient practitioner in the data engineering and analysis domain, Senior Solution Architect's become the top practitioners and authority on use of Fivetran within a complex modern data stack and be a voice of the customer cross departmentally to our product and marketing teams.  As a Lead Solution Architect   at Fivetran, you will:   Actively serving as a technical advisor to a portfolio of assigned accounts including major consumer, prosumer and B2B brands.  Working on new customer onboarding to map their business needs and design solutions tailored to their use cases and needs.  Collaborate with customers in a highly strategic manner to develop their success roadmap for the first 12 months of Fivetran adoption and beyond.  Develop collaboratively with our Sales Engineers, Support Engineers and Account Managers the technical artifacts that support organisational success of usage of Fivetran  Proactively identifying opportunities for upsell and account expansion and ensuring where this requires wider implementation of our product that this is technically and commercially sound.  Share your domain experience and create playbooks, knowledge assets and semi-formal training for various internal technical roles.  Identify product feedback from customers, spotting trends and surfacing to help shape product roadmap  Act as a coach and mentor to junior team members   What you'll bring to the table:   Experience helping grow a team of technologists, including coaching and mentoring junior team members, creating thought leading content, and collaborating to drive toward goals you help define.  You are a highly experienced technologist with unique views and perspectives on the value of technology in general and data more specifically, you educate those around you  You work well with other organizations within your company, driving successful delivery of cross-departmental initiatives  Data is your thing. A solid understanding of the data space - cloud infrastructure, database technologies, visualisation tools and other enabling technologies  You understand people. Deeply emotionally intelligent, you can quickly read a room of stakeholders and adopt your delivery style and content quickly  Confidence is key. Previous experience with a complex software product, ideally designing solutions and gathering requirements, you are comfortable communicating with technical and business subject matter experts  Business challenge? Let me help. A passion for working at the intersection of technology and business problems - this role is always about delivering business impact for our customers through data  You CAN see the needle in the haystack. As a trusted advisor to our clients you will be pivotal in spotting new opportunities where Fivetran could add even more value to our customers.  Experience and acumen in multiple areas of modern technology and the modern data stack. This includes SQL expertise, knowledge of cloud data warehouses, cloud provider services (AWS, Google, Azure), ETL/ELT tools, data modeling/engineering, data science/machine learning, api consumption, scripting (python preferred), general networking knowledge and cloud SaaS applications (Zendesk, Salesforce, Marketo, etc…).  Perks and Benefits:  100% paid Medical, Dental, Vision and Basic Life Insurance. Benefits begin on your first day!  Option of Health Savings Account (HSA) or Flexible Savings Account (FSA)  Generous paid time off (PTO) plus paid sick time, holidays, parental leave, and volunteer days off  401k match program  Eligible donation match program  Monthly cell phone stipend  Work-from-home equipment reimbursement for your home office setup!  Professional development and training opportunities  Company virtual happy hours, free food, and fun team building activities  Commuter benefits to help with transit and parking costs  Employee Assistance Program (EAP)  Referral Bonuses  Stock equity - every employee is granted stock options when they walk in the door  Annual Camp Fivetran trip that brings together every employee from around the world We're honored to be valued at over $5.6 billion, but more importantly, we're proud of our core values of Get Stuck In, Do the Right Thing, and One Team, One Dream. To learn more about Fivetran's culture and what it's like to be part of the team, click here and enjoy our video.  To learn more about our candidate privacy policy, you can read our statement here.
